name: Luis Villalobos
review: My first MacBook ever! I had been saving up for it before the official drop— & I was not disappointed! Love the Touch ID feature, and it’s so efficient! Can’t wait to use it when I go back to school!

name: Harleen Deol
review: The upgrade from my 2014 MacBook Pro was easy, as one expects from Apple. The new display is noticeably brighter. My zoom meetings look like I'm in a brighter space. I bought a USB-C (thunderbolt 3) to USB adaptor so I could use my old Time Machine drive.

name: Cody
review: This MacBook is assume. A bit of a challenge learning their OS after 15 years on windows but it was worth the buy. The M1 is powerful and does heavy 4k video rendering without getting warm. This blows away anything Intel has. It runs Microsoft 365 so all my files are available on one drive.

name: Charlotte Smith
review: To be very fair any laptop would have been a upgrade for me. Haven't purchased one since 2014. But this MacBook in the 14 inch is great. Ready to use it to it's full potential. Also ready for more options of cases and sleeves to be available.

name: Christine Q.
review: It is small, light, and fast. Has an excellent screen. And for such a small light computer I do like all the ports that it has. Of course I had to get all new cables/adapters since none of the ports on my old MacBook Pro matched. This MacBook has no USB A port, so you will need an adapter to read that stack of USB flash drives.

name: Clara Del
review: Although it’s taking me several weeks to get all the “ducks in a row” and transfer all my stuff from my 2012 iMac, this machine is phenomenal. It does things differently, but way more efficiently. I really love it. Welcome to a new decade.
